casebody.data:
CASIMIR KUROWSKI AND LUCILLE KUROWSKI, HIS WIFE, PLAINTIFFS-APPELLANTS, v. BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT OF THE CITY OF BAYONNE, A CORPORATE BODY, AND MORRIS PADWE, DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued January 2, 1951 — Decided January 17, 1951.

*444Before Judges Freund, Proctor and Rogers.

Mr. Stephen P. Piga argued the cause for the plaintiffskppellants. Mr. William Rubin argued the cause for the defendant-respondent Board of Adjustment of the City of Bayonne. Mr. A. Alfred Fink, attorney for defendant-respondent Morris Padwe. Per Curiam.

The judgment is affirmed for the reasons expressed in the opinion of Judge Brennan in the court below.
